page.title: 02AXBRIDGE
page.content: {Axbridge}is a town two miles from Cheddar, it lies just below the Mendip Hills.It became a borough before the first Domesday survey! It has a Town Crier, a Mayor, a Council and nearly twenty shops including a butchers shop, a post office, a hardware store and a fruit shop. {The Square}is the main focal point of the town- off which there are many old streets.-The church is to the N.E.of the square.In summer the place bustles with visitors enjoying the many attractions of this picturesque town. {The High Street}contains many historic buildings including King Johns Hunting Lodge.(it has no connection with King John). The Town hall contains a museum. Another historic feature of the town is the Old Manor House. There is an infants school, an adventure playpark and a hospital.
